Vocabularies.Definition: going or ready to go in the direction of 驶往；去
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  This ship is bound for Tokyo.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  start, engage in (a war, campaign, etc.) 发动
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The government is waging a campaign against sex discrimination in industry.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   people working on a ship, plane, etc. 全体（机组）人员，全体船员
v.   go looking for (sth.) 侦察，搜索，寻找 n.  侦察员，侦察机
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We'd better start scouting for a new secretary.

Vocabularies.Definition: give a piece of secret information or a warning to (sb.) 向…密报，事先警告
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Someone tipped off the police about the robbery.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. seize (sb.) with the authority of the law 逮捕，拘留 n.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He was arrested when customs officers found drugs in his bag.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.    联邦（制）的，（美国）联邦政府的 n. (F-) （美国）联邦调查局成员
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The Trans-Canada highway is a federal responsibility.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a stage in a process of change or development 阶段，时期
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The child is going through a difficult phase.

Vocabularies.Definition: place special meaning or importance on (sth.) 强调
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Some schools put great emphasis on language study.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. (underwent undergone) experience or endure 经历，遭受，忍受
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. The ship successfully underwent sea trials in coastal waters.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. persuade, attract 诱惑，吸引
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He was tempted into a life of crime by greed and laziness.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. reserve (a room, seat, table etc.) 预订，登记
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Book early if you want to be sure of a seat.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    司法，审判；正义，正当，公平
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He demanded, with some justice, that he should be given an opportunity to express his views.

Vocabularies.Definition: cause (sth.) to arise 引起，造成    vi. （拍照时）摆好姿势
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Winter poses particular difficulties for the elderly.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. respond to ...with an opposite view 反驳，反击 n.  柜台；计数器，筹码
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  They countered our proposal with one of their own.

Vocabularies.Definition: trace the source of; knock down; (allow) to decline 追查…的来源；撞倒；（使）衰退
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The criminal was eventually run down in the woods near his home.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   政府首脑会议，峰会；顶点，顶峰
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The president is currently attending a summit in Washington.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt., n.   屠杀，残杀；屠宰
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The playwright was slaughtered by the press.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  主人，东道主   vt. （作为主人）招待
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We thanked our hosts for the lovely evening.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 新兵，新成员 v. 招募，招聘
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The police are trying to recruit more black and Asian officers.
